The report from DailyWire: com, a right-wing website, falsely claimed that "Mohammed" was the most popular name given to baby boys in the Netherlands in 2017.
The mainstream media in the Netherlands: including Nos.nl, reported that "Noah" was actually the most popular baby name for boys in the country.
A journalist at Powned: tv, a Dutch blog known for its right-leaning and offensive content, found that 636 babies were named "Mohammed" in 2017 by checking for all its alternative spellings.
The methodology used by PowNed: tv to determine that "Mohammed" was the most popular boys' name in 2017 was flawed, as it tallied all variations of the name together, while the Social Insurance Bank (SVB) ranks names by specific spellings.
